Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Multiplex \Mul"ti*plex\, a. [L. multiplex, -plicis. See {Multiply}.] Manifold; multiple. [1913 Webster]

multiplex adj 1: many and varied; having many features or forms; "manifold reasons"; "our manifold failings"; "manifold intelligence"; "the multiplex opportunities in high technology" [syn: {manifold}] 2: having many parts or aspects; "the multiplex problem of drug abuse" n : communicates two or more signals over a common channel
